means: 拿住，握住
保留，保存
扣留，拘押
容纳
拿住，握住
同意，赞成
保持不变
有效
握住
保留
控制
[人名] 霍尔德

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"包括，包含"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: contain, include, embrace, involve, comprehend, hold, comprise
means: contain ： 普通用词，所涉及的物体常常是其组成部分或内容。强调包容关系。既可指具体有形的东西，也可指抽象无形的东西。
include ： 普通用词，指一整体包含着各独立的部分，也指某东西包含另一东西的某一部分。
embrace ： 正式用词，指把某事物纳入整个之中。
involve ： 把包含因整体的性质决定的成分或结果。所包括的往往是无形的，不可触知的东西，多用作引申。
comprehend ： 正工用词，指包含在整体范围以内。
hold ： 常和contain换用。指能够容纳或有足够的容纳量。强调包容能力。
comprise ： 书面用词，暗指一个整体包括不同部分所组成，可与include交换使用。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"有，具有，持有"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: have, hold, own, possess, keep, enjoy
means: have ： 最常用词，可指任何情况下的具有，无论是物质的或精神的。
hold ： 指拥有并保持财产及持有见解等，暗示不让别人拿走或占有。
own不及本组的possess正式，多指所属关系，强调所有权，不管所属物是否在物主手中。
possess ： 较正式，指拥有或占有并能加以控制与支配，强调其归属；也指具有某种品质、才能、特点或性能等。
keep ： 指长时间地保有，保存某物，防止别人占去，强调安全和感情上的依附。
enjoy ： 指享有某种权利或长处，带有欣赏或喜爱的情感。

sentence.Network_en: He struggled to hold the bike down on the banked corners.
sentence.Network_cn: 拐过斜弯时他竭力将自行车把稳。

sentence.Network_en: It is hard to get hold of guns in this country.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这个国家里要搞到枪支是很困难的。

sentence.Network_en: They can't believe you can even hold a conversation.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们不敢相信你竟然能够把一场对话进行下去。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 在此保持(hold)住，打开另一个控制台，找到test的PID。如果你想图省事的话，就这样：$ cat /proc/`pgrep test`/maps  你将看到如下 …
一是持有（hold）（Hold），不考虑拍卖后市场出清利率水平，当前持有（hold）者继续原先的份额，这些份额在拍卖中就不列入出售份额，但本次拍 …
字典中奉字的解释 ... (17) 供奉,供养[ supply] (18) 持,拿[ hold] (19) 辅助,拥戴[ assist;support].
字典中携字的解释 ... (2) 同本义(把地上的物品举提起来)[ carry in hand] (4) 拿着,持[ hold] (6) 牵挽;挽扶[ lead].

list.abs: 大学英语四级常用词组 ... hold...against 记恨 hold back 踌躇，退缩不前，阻止 hold down 压制；抑制(热情等).
大学英语四级常用词组 ... hold one's own 坚守住，不被打败 hold out 伸出；坚持；支持 hold up 举起；耽搁；抢劫.
我的博客 - 王者天下 - 网易博客 ... 4. Me too． 我也是。 8. Hold on． 等一等。 10. Not bad． 还不错。.
Bobby McFerrin_百度百科 ... 4 前进 Ride On 5 坚持（hold on） Hold On 10 塔潘·比 TAPAN BIE.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... hold out 伸出；坚持；支持 hold up 举起；耽搁；抢劫 hold water (容器等)盛得住水.

jx.jx_en_mean: To retain in one's possession or control
jx.jx_cn_mean: 保留，保持控制：在某人的占据或控制之下

lj.lj_ly: held back valuable information; held back my tears.
lj.lj_ls: 保留有价值的信息；忍住眼泪

jx.jx_en_mean: To impede the progress of.
To restrain oneself.
To limit
To have (a job)
To talk at great length.
To keep at a distance; resist
To stop or delay doing something

lj.lj_ly: Let's hold off until we have more data.
lj.lj_ls: 等到有更多资料时再做

jx.jx_en_mean: To maintain one's grip; cling.
To continue to do something; persist.
To wait for something wanted or requested, especially to keep a telephone connection open.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 稍待：尤指不挂上电话以等待想要的或要求的事物

jx.jx_en_mean: To present or proffer as something attainable.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 提供，提出：提供或显示可得到的东西

jx.jx_en_mean: To continue to be in supply or service; last

lj.lj_ly: Our food is holding out nicely.

jx.jx_en_mean: To continue to resist

lj.lj_ly: The defending garrison held out for a month.
lj.lj_ls: 防卫部队已坚守了一个月

jx.jx_en_mean: To refuse to reach or satisfy an agreement.
To postpone or delay.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 继续维持：处于与以前同样状态或情形

jx.jx_en_mean: To continue a term of office past the usual length of time.
To prolong the engagement of

lj.lj_ly: The film was held over for weeks.
lj.lj_ls: 电影又继续放了几星期

jx.jx_en_mean: To remain loyal or faithful to
To obstruct or delay.
To rob while armed, often at gunpoint.
To offer or present as an example

lj.lj_ly: held the essay up as a model for the students.
lj.lj_ls: 把这篇论文给学生作范例

jx.jx_en_mean: To continue to function without losing force or effectiveness; cope
jx.jx_cn_mean: 制衡，应付：仍然有效或不失力量地继续下去；应付

lj.lj_ly: managed to hold up under the daily stress.
lj.lj_ls: 想办法应付每天的生活压力

jx.jx_en_mean: To agree with; support

lj.lj_ly: I don't hold with your theories.

phrase.cizu_name: be left holding the baby (或美bag)

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)be left with an unwelcome responsibility, typically without warning
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（尤指没有警告）被加一项责任

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English haldan, healdan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch houden and German halten; the noun is partly from Old Norse hald 'hold, support, custody'
late 16th cent.: from obsolete holl, from Old English hol (see hole). The addition of -d was due to association with hold

entry.def: When you hold something, you carry or support it, using your hands or your arms.

example.ex: Hold the knife at an angle...
example.tran: 斜握住刀。

example.ex: She is holding her journal and a pen...
example.tran: 她手里拿着日记和一支笔。

entry.def: Hold is used in expressions such as grab hold of ,catch hold of, and get hold of, to indicate that you close your hand tightly around something, for example to stop something moving or falling.

example.ex: I was woken up by someone grabbing hold of my sleeping bag...
example.tran: 有人猛地抓住了我的睡袋，把我惊醒了。

example.ex: A doctor and a nurse caught hold of his arms...
example.tran: 一名医生和一名护士抓住了他的双臂。

entry.tran: （通常为表示喜爱或安慰而）拥抱，抱住
entry.def: When you hold someone, you put your arms round them, usually because you want to show them how much you like them or because you want to comfort them.

example.ex: If only he would hold her close to him.
example.tran: 要是他能将她拥入怀中就好了。

entry.def: If you hold someone in a particular position, you use force to keep them in that position and stop them from moving.

example.ex: He then held the man in an armlock until police arrived...
example.tran: 然后他反扭住那名男子的手臂让他动弹不得，直到警察赶到。

example.ex: I'd got two nurses holding me down.
example.tran: 两名护士按着我不让我乱动。

entry.tran: （使某人不得动弹的）抓住，夹住
entry.def: A hold is a particular way of keeping someone in a position using your own hands, arms, or legs.

example.ex: ...use of an unauthorized hold on a handcuffed suspect.
example.tran: 对戴手铐的嫌疑犯使用非法的擒拿方式

entry.def: When you hold a part of your body, you put your hand on or against it, often because it hurts.

example.ex: Soon she was crying bitterly about the pain and was holding her throat.
example.tran: 很快她痛得大哭起来，同时用手捂着自己的喉咙。

entry.tran: 使（身体部位）保持（某种姿势）
entry.def: When you hold a part of your body in a particular position, you put it into that position and keep it there.

example.ex: Hold your hands in front of your face...
example.tran: 把双手举在面前。

example.ex: He walked at a rapid pace with his back straight and his head held erect.
example.tran: 他昂首挺胸地快步而行。

entry.def: If one thing holds another in a particular position, it keeps it in that position.

example.ex: ...the wooden wedge which held the heavy door open...
example.tran: 卡住沉重的门不让它关上的木楔

example.ex: They used steel pins to hold everything in place.
example.tran: 他们用钢钉将所有东西都固定住。

entry.def: If one thing is used to hold another, it is used to store it.

example.ex: Two knife racks hold her favourite knives.
example.tran: 两个刀架上存放着她最心爱的刀具。

example.ex: ...the large cardboard and wooden cases used to hold my new appliances.
example.tran: 用来装我新买的家用电器的几个大的纸箱和木箱

entry.def: In a ship or aeroplane, a hold is a place where cargo or luggage is stored.

example.ex: A fire had been reported in the cargo hold.
example.tran: 行李舱内报称起火了。

entry.def: If a place holds something, it keeps it available for reference or for future use.

example.ex: The Small Firms Service holds an enormous amount of information on any business problem...
example.tran: 小型企业服务处备有关于各种商务问题的海量信息。

example.ex: We have reviewed the data that we hold for the area.
example.tran: 我们已经审核过为该地区保存的数据了。

entry.def: If something holds a particular amount of something, it can contain that amount.

example.ex: The small bottles don't seem to hold much...
example.tran: 这些小瓶子好像装不下多少。

example.ex: One CD-ROM disk can hold over 100,000 pages of text.
example.tran: 一张光盘可以存储十多万多页的文字资料。

entry.def: If you can hold your drink, you are able to drink large quantities of alcohol without becoming ill or getting drunk.

example.ex: ...but you had to be able to hold your liquor.
example.tran: 但你得能喝酒才行。

entry.def: If a vehicle holds the road well, it remains in close contact with the road and can be controlled safely and easily.

example.ex: I thought the car held the road really well.
example.tran: 我认为这辆车抓地性能真的非常好。

usage_note.note: Hold is often used to indicate that someone or something has the particular thing, characteristic, or attitude that is mentioned. Therefore it takes most of its meaning from the word that follows it.
usage_note.translation: hold 常用来表示某人或某物具备所提到的某种东西、特征或态度，因此其意义主要视后接之词而定。

entry.def: Hold is used with words and expressions indicating an opinion or belief, to show that someone has a particular opinion or believes that something is true.

example.ex: He held firm opinions which usually conflicted with my own...
example.tran: 他对自己的观点坚定不移，而这些观点通常和我的相左。

example.ex: He holds certain expectations about the teacher's role...
example.tran: 他对教师的角色抱有某些期待。

entry.tran: 带给人，使人感到（害怕、神秘等）
entry.def: Hold is used with words such as 'fear' or 'mystery' to indicate someone's feelings towards something, as if those feelings were a characteristic of the thing itself.

example.ex: Death doesn't hold any fear for me...
example.tran: 死亡对我来说并不可怕。

example.ex: It held more mystery than even the darkest jungle...
example.tran: 它甚至比最黑暗的丛林还更令人感到神秘。

entry.tran: 担任（职务）;掌握（权力）;负有（责任）
entry.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'office', 'power', and 'responsibility' to indicate that someone has a particular position of power or authority.

example.ex: She has never held ministerial office...
example.tran: 她从未担任过部长级职务。

example.ex: I'd seen it before in people who held immense power.
example.tran: 我以前曾在掌握大权的人身上看到过这种情况。

entry.tran: 持有（许可、票证等）;拥有（学位等）
entry.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'permit', 'degree', or 'ticket' to indicate that someone has a particular document that allows them to do something.

example.ex: Applicants should normally hold a good Honours degree...
example.tran: 申请人通常应该拥有优秀荣誉学位。

example.ex: He did not hold a firearm certificate...
example.tran: 他没有持枪许可。

entry.tran: 举行（聚会、会议、会谈、选举、审判等）
entry.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'party', 'meeting', 'talks', 'election', and 'trial' to indicate that people are organizing a particular activity.

example.ex: The country will hold democratic elections within a year...
example.tran: 该国将在一年之内举行民主选举。

example.ex: The German sports federation said it would hold an investigation.
example.tran: 德国体育联合会称它将进行调查。

entry.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'conversation', 'interview', and 'talks' to indicate that two or more people meet and discuss something.

example.ex: The Prime Minister, is holding consultations with his colleagues to finalise the deal...
example.tran: 首相正在和同僚进行磋商，以敲定该协议。

example.ex: The engineer and his son held frequent consultations concerning technical problems...
example.tran: 工程师和他的儿子经常就技术问题互相征求意见。

entry.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'shares' and 'stock' to indicate that someone owns a particular proportion of a business.

example.ex: The group said it continues to hold 1,774,687 Vons shares...
example.tran: 该集团称其继续持有1,774,687股冯氏公司的股份。

example.ex: The Fisher family holds 40% of the stock.
example.tran: 费希尔家族持有40%的股份。

entry.def: Hold is used with words such as 'lead' or 'advantage' to indicate that someone is winning or doing well in a contest.

example.ex: He continued to hold a lead in Angola's presidential race...
example.tran: 他继续在安哥拉总统大选中占据领先地位。

example.ex: Mestel holds a slight advantage.
example.tran: 梅斯特尔占有微弱优势。

entry.tran: 吸引住（注意力）;保持（兴趣）
entry.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'attention' or 'interest' to indicate that what you do or say keeps someone interested or listening to you.

example.ex: If you want to hold someone's attention, look them directly in the eye but don't stare...
example.tran: 如果想吸引住某人的注意力，就要直视他们的眼睛，但别死盯着。

example.ex: Couldn't I hold Philippe's interest?
example.tran: 我难道就不能让菲利普一直感兴趣吗？

entry.def: If you hold someone responsible, liable, or accountable for something, you will blame them if anything goes wrong.

example.ex: It's impossible to hold any individual responsible.
example.tran: 不可能归咎于任何个人。

example.ex: ...shareholders who want to hold corporate directors more accountable for their actions.
example.tran: 想让公司董事为自己的行为负更大责任的股东们

entry.def: If someone holds you in a place, they keep you there as a prisoner and do not allow you to leave.

example.ex: The inside of a van was as good a place as any to hold a kidnap victim...
example.tran: 小货车内是关押被绑架人的好地方。

example.ex: Somebody is holding your wife hostage...
example.tran: 有人挟持了你妻子作为人质。

entry.def: If people such as an army or a violent crowd hold a place, they control it by using force.

example.ex: Demonstrators have been holding the square since Sunday.
example.tran: 示威者从周日起就占领了广场。

entry.tran: （因握有某人把柄或掌握权力而形成的）控制力，支配力
entry.def: If you have a hold over someone, you have power or control over them, for example because you know something about them you can use to threaten them or because you are in a position of authority.

example.ex: It's always useful to have a hold over a fellow like Carl May...
example.tran: 能支配像卡尔·梅这样的人总是很有用的。

example.ex: He had ordered his officers to keep an exceptionally firm hold over their men...
example.tran: 他已经命令军官要倍加严格地管住自己的手下。

entry.tran: （接电话时让对方）稍等，不要挂断
entry.def: If you ask someone to hold, or to hold the line, when you are answering a telephone call, you are asking them to wait for a short time, for example so that you can find the person they want to speak to.

example.ex: Could you hold the line and I'll just get my pen...
example.tran: 能否请您稍等一会儿，我拿支笔？

example.ex: A telephone operator asked him to hold.
example.tran: 电话接线员让他不要挂断。

entry.tran: 代接（电话）并向受话人转告通话内容
entry.def: If you hold telephone calls for someone, you do not allow people who phone to speak to that person, but take messages instead.

example.ex: He tells his secretary to hold his calls.
example.tran: 他让秘书代接电话。

entry.def: If something holds at a particular value or level, or is held there, it is kept at that value or level.

example.ex: OPEC production is holding at around 21.5 million barrels a day...
example.tran: 石油输出国组织的石油产量保持在每天约2,150万桶。

example.ex: They were expecting the jobless rate to hold steady...
example.tran: 他们预计失业率会保持稳定。

entry.def: If you hold a sound or musical note, you continue making it.

example.ex: ...a voice which hit and held every note with perfect ease and clarity.
example.tran: 非常自如清晰地唱出并拉长每个音符的歌喉

entry.def: If you hold something such as a train, a lift, or an elevator, you delay it.

example.ex: A London Underground spokesman defended the decision to hold the train until police arrived.
example.tran: 伦敦地铁公司的发言人为推迟发车直到警方赶来的决定作了辩解。

entry.def: If an offer or invitation still holds, it is still available for you to accept.

example.ex: Does your offer still hold?
example.tran: 你的提议仍然有效吗？

entry.def: If a good situation holds, it continues and does not get worse or fail.

example.ex: Our luck couldn't hold for ever...
example.tran: 我们不会永远走运。

example.ex: Would the weather hold?...
example.tran: 天气会保持晴好吗？

entry.def: If an argument or theory holds, it is true or valid, even after close examination.

example.ex: Today, most people think that argument no longer holds...
example.tran: 今天，大多数人认为那个论点已经站不住脚了。

example.ex: The theory could still hold.
example.tran: 该理论有可能仍然成立。

entry.def: If part of a structure holds, it does not fall or break although there is a lot of force or pressure on it.

example.ex: How long would the roof hold?
example.tran: 房顶能支撑多久？

entry.def: If laws or rules hold, they exist and remain in force.

example.ex: These laws also hold for universities.
example.tran: 这些法律也适用于各大学。

entry.def: If you say that you hold to a particular opinion or belief, you are stating firmly that you continue to have that opinion or belief.

example.ex: I hold to my belief that people should be allowed to have private lives...
example.tran: 我坚信应该允许人们拥有自己的私生活。

example.ex: Would you still hold to that view?
example.tran: 你仍会坚持那个看法吗？

entry.tran: 遵守，恪守（承诺或高尚的行为准则）
entry.def: If you hold to a promise or to high standards of behaviour, you keep that promise or continue to behave according to those standards.

example.ex: Will the President be able to hold to this commit-ment?...
example.tran: 总统能恪守此承诺吗？

example.ex: Not all men are as honorable or hold to the same standards as Sam.
example.tran: 不是所有的人都像萨姆那样品德如此高尚，抑或恪守同样的道德准则。

entry.tran: 使遵守，使恪守（承诺或高尚的行为准则）
entry.def: If someone or something holds you to a promise or to high standards of behaviour, they make you keep that promise or those standards.

example.ex: I would say it's almost time to hold him to that promise...
example.tran: 我认为已经差不多是时候让他兑现那个承诺了。

example.ex: Don't hold me to that...
example.tran: 我不能百分百保证。

entry.def: If you hold forth on a subject, you speak confidently and for a long time about it, especially to a group of people.

example.ex: Barry was holding forth on politics.
example.tran: 巴里正在滔滔不绝地谈论政治。

entry.def: If you get hold of an object or information, you obtain it, usually after some difficulty.

example.ex: It is hard to get hold of guns in this country.
example.tran: 在这个国家里要搞到枪支是很困难的。

entry.def: If you get hold of a fact or a subject, you learn about it and understand it well.

example.ex: He first had to get hold of some basic facts.
example.tran: 他首先得弄清一些基本事实。

entry.def: If you get hold of someone, you manage to contact them.

example.ex: The only electrician we could get hold of was miles away.
example.tran: 我们唯一能够联络到的电工离这里有好几英里远。

entry.def: If you say 'Hold it', you are telling someone to stop what they are doing and to wait.

example.ex: Hold it! Don't move!
example.tran: 停下！别动！

entry.def: If you put something on hold, you decide not to do it, deal with it, or change it now, but to leave it until later.

example.ex: He put his retirement on hold until he had found a solution...
example.tran: 他推迟了退休，直到他找到了解决办法。

example.ex: He described their foreign policy as on hold.
example.tran: 他将他们的外交政策称为缓兵之计。

entry.tran: （面对攻击、反对等）顶住，坚持住
entry.def: If you hold your own, you are able to resist someone who is attacking or opposing you.

example.ex: The Frenchman held his own against the challenger.
example.tran: 这名法国人顶住了挑战者的进攻。

entry.def: If you can do something well enough to hold your own, you do not appear foolish when you are compared with someone who is generally thought to be very good at it.

example.ex: She can hold her own against almost any player.
example.tran: 她几乎能和任何一名选手一较高下。

entry.def: If you hold still, you do not move.

example.ex: Can't you hold still for a second?
example.tran: 你一秒钟不动都做不到吗？

entry.def: If something takes hold, it gains complete control or influence over a person or thing.

example.ex: She felt a strange excitement taking hold of her...
example.tran: 她浑身感到一股莫名的兴奋。

example.ex: She was determined not to let the illness take hold again.
example.tran: 她决心不让疾病再次击垮自己。

entry.def: If you hold tight, you put your hand round or against something in order to prevent yourself from falling over. A bus driver might say 'Hold tight!' to you if you are standing on a bus when it is about to move.

example.ex: He held tight to the rope...
example.tran: 他牢牢抓住绳子。

example.ex: Climb on to my back and hold tight.
example.tran: 爬到我背上抓紧了。

entry.def: If you hold tight, you do not immediately start a course of action that you have been planning or thinking about.

example.ex: The unions have circulated their branches, urging members to hold tight until a national deal is struck.
example.tran: 各工会已经在其分支机构中作了宣传工作，敦促会员等到达成全国性协议后再行动。

sentences.sentence: "he released his clasp on my arm"
"he has a strong grip for an old man"
"she kept a firm hold on the railing"

means.word_mean: 2. understanding of the nature or meaning or quality or magnitude of something;

sentences.sentence: "he has a good grasp of accounting practices"

means.word_mean: 3. power by which something or someone is affected or dominated;
4. time during which some action is awaited;

sentences.sentence: "instant replay caused too long a delay"
"he ordered a hold in the action"

means.word_mean: 5. a state of being confined (usually for a short time);

sentences.sentence: "he is in the custody of police"

means.word_mean: 7. a cell in a jail or prison
8. the appendage to an object that is designed to be held in order to use or move it;

sentences.sentence: "he grabbed the hammer by the handle"
"it was an old briefcase but it still had a good grip"

means.word_mean: 9. the space in a ship or aircraft for storing cargo
2. keep in a certain state, position, or activity; e.g., "keep clean";

sentences.sentence: "She always held herself as a lady"
"The students keep me on my toes"

means.word_mean: 3. have or hold in one's hands or grip;

sentences.sentence: "Hold this bowl for a moment, please"
"A crazy idea took hold of him"

means.word_mean: 4. to close within bounds, limit or hold back from movement;

sentences.sentence: "This holds the local until the express passengers change trains"
"About a dozen animals were held inside the stockade"
"The illegal immigrants were held at a detention center"
"The terrorists held the journalists for ransom"

means.word_mean: 5. have rightfully; of rights, titles, and offices;

sentences.sentence: "He held the governorship for almost a decade"

means.word_mean: 6. have or possess, either in a concrete or an abstract sense;

sentences.sentence: "She holds a Master's degree from Harvard"

means.word_mean: 7. keep in mind or convey as a conviction or view;
9. lessen the intensity of; temper; hold in restraint; hold or keep within limits;
10. remain in a certain state, position, or condition;

sentences.sentence: "They held on the road and kept marching"
"Rousseau's philosophy holds that people are inherently good"

means.word_mean: 14. secure and keep for possible future use or application;
15. be the physical support of; carry the weight of;

sentences.sentence: "He supported me with one hand while I balanced on the beam"

means.word_mean: 18. support or hold in a certain manner;
19. have room for; hold without crowding;

sentences.sentence: "The auditorium can't hold more than 500 people"

means.word_mean: 20. be capable of holding or containing;

sentences.sentence: "This box won't take all the items"

means.word_mean: 22. take and maintain control over, often by violent means;

sentences.sentence: "The dissatisfied students held the President's office for almost a week"

means.word_mean: 23. protect against a challenge or attack;

sentences.sentence: "Hold the bridge against the enemy's attacks"
"judge held that the defendant was innocent"
"The book holds in store much valuable advise"

means.word_mean: 27. bind by an obligation; cause to be indebted;
28. cover as for protection against noise or smell;

sentences.sentence: "She held her ears when the jackhammer started to operate"

means.word_mean: 29. drink alcohol without showing ill effects;

sentences.sentence: "he had drunk more than he could carry"

means.word_mean: 30. be pertinent or relevant or applicable;

sentences.sentence: "This theory holds for all irrational numbers"

means.word_mean: 31. arrange for and reserve (something for someone else) in advance;

sentences.sentence: "reserve me a seat on a flight"
"The agent booked tickets to the show for the whole family"
"The new material withstands even the greatest wear and tear"
"hold all calls to the President's office while he is in a meeting"
"Hold the fire extinguisher directly on the flames"

means.word_mean: 36. be in accord; be in agreement;

sentences.sentence: "We agreed on the terms of the settlement"
"I hold with those who say life is sacred"

slang.tokens: not able to hold a candle to

example.en: The cake from the bakery is not able to hold a candle to the one that Grandmonther made.
example.zh: 店里买来的蛋糕跟奶奶做的无法相比。

Sentence.sentence: But they have a powerful hold on many people nonetheless, a hold extending far beyond their literary content.
But they have a powerful hold on many people nonetheless, a hold extending far beyond their literary content.

Speakers or English have a similar gesture through the hand may not be cupped and the fingers may be held more loosely, but for them the gesture means goodbye or go away, quite the opposite of the Colombian gesture.

sentences.en: Hold the baby a minute, please.
She was holding her sides with laughter.
I hold that this is a right decision.
sentences.cn: 我相信这是个正确的决定。

sentences.en: The box can hold all my clothes.
sentences.cn: 这箱子能装下我的全部衣服。

sentences.en: They will hold a meeting to discuss this problem tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 他们明天将开会讨论这个问题。

means.word_mean: 握住, 抓住; 控制, 掌握

sentences.en: They have strengthened their hold on the troops.
sentences.cn: 他们已加强对军队的控制。

sentences.en: There are no holds for the hands on the wall.

jushi.english: I hope the fine weather holds until they arrive home, at least.
jushi.chinese: 我希望这好天气至少持续到他们到家。

jushi.english: How long will this fine weather hold?
jushi.chinese: 这种好天气能持续多久?
